info.description:
This api controlls the flow of a game and provides it's data.
It is desiged to be RESTfull so the structure works simmilar as file system.
The service will run and only work in a local network, `game.host` is the IP of the Computer hosting the game and will be found via a IP scan
info.title: Robot Rally Game logic engine

tags.description:
All actions needed to interact with players.
Keep in mid that a player is *not* a robot
tags.name: Players

tags.description: All actions needed to interact with the game itself and mostly to get information

Join the given game. You will get your ID by doing this, if you already in the game you can get your ID again if you lost it.
The id is neccessary for any further API calls

get.description:
All events needed by the client are accessible here. (Usefull for animations)
More about this function is found in the [regarding Github Issue](https://github.com/FactoryRally/game-controller/issues/6)

**This function only returns the type of the event you need to fetch the data seperately**
> Read more at [api-usage.md](https://github.com/FactoryRally/game-controller/blob/master/documentation/rest/api-usage.md#events--updates)

parameters.description: The id of the game to interact with
parameters.name: game_id

parameters.description:
If true you will get all past events at once
If false the list only contains the oldest unfetched event
parameters.name: batch

parameters.description:
If true the server will not responde until a event is added to the queue

Rrequires less traffic but might impacts the servers performance or cause timeouts at the client
parameters.name: wait

409.description: The error message including a human readable description

ErrorResponse.description: The error message including a human readable description

Tile.description:
A tile is a square at the Game field
**Note:** * `direction` is only aviable for belts * properties with a `rotator-` prefix are only aviable for rotator (parts)

empty.description: If there is no player at the tile this is true

level.description: The height of the tile. 1 = default

Tile.title: Tile

TileType.description: The type defines the function of a tile and how it is displayed. The behaviour is unknown to the client
TileType.title: TileType

Direction.description: Defines a direction in a 2D system. the X and Y values can be defined by the client.
Direction.title: Direction

RotatorPosition.description: The rotator blocks consist of 4 blocks. This 4 blocks can be differenciated by this property
RotatorPosition.title: RotatorPosition

Rotation.description: Defines wether to turn left or right
Rotation.title: Rotation

Entity.description:
Describes a actor at the game board. Not to be confused with `Player` which is the person controlling the Entity.
this will *most likely* be a player controlled robot but it also can be a AI controlled Entity or robot > We did use Entity instead of the word Robot or bot because the word *bot* is used for the AIs controlling the robot. And also because theoretial a entity can be a not robot entity

name.description: The default rule for names in the game
name.title: Name

id.description:
The unique identification of this entity.
*!!!* This is not the id of the player
This value will be autogenerated by the api and is read only

Entity.title: Entity

GameRules.description: Game Rules define the rules for a Game

player-names-visible.description: If true players can see the name of the player controlling a robot

max-players.description: The maximum ammount of players able to join the game

name.description: The visible name of the game

robots-per-player.description: Defines the number of robots per player

fill-with-bots.description: If true emply player slots are going to be filled up with AI enemys

GameRules.title: GameRules

Game.description:
A Game is like a lobby, people can join/leave.
A Game is created by a host who does *not* needs to attend the game as a player but in the most cases he will. This is *read-only*

id.description:
**Unique**
This is the parameter a game is identified by
id.title: GameID

name.description:
The name is **unique** but it should ***not*** be used as identifer (it's not natively supportet)
It is used to display the game's name

players.description:
The list of players attending the game.
(Only contains the name of the players)

Game.title: Game

GameID.description:
**Unique**
This is the parameter a game is identified by
GameID.title: GameID

Name.description: The default rule for names in the game
Name.title: Name

GameInfo.description:
Describes the current state of the game. It does not includes the gamedata (like players/poitions/field) but general information.

This is read only

passed-time.description: The time passed since the game started in secconds. If the game is not started it will be `0`

hardware-compatible.description:
Not every game can be connected to hardware (for example to many bots)

If this is true it means you can use this game with hardware

player-on-turn.description:
This id uniquely identifys the player (in a game).

 **Not** to be confused with the `uid` which is used for authentication
player-on-turn.title: PlayerID

name.description: The default rule for names in the game
name.title: Name

max-players.description: The maximum count of players that can participate in this game

current-players.description: The numbers of players in the game

password-protected.description: True if the game has a password in order to join

GameInfo.title: Game Info

GameState.description:
The phase the game is currently in
* `Lobby`: Players are able to join, Bots able to be added. Host can decide to start the game and leave the phase
* `Planning`: **[BETA - Not in game]** Players can choose their type of robot/bots bots autopick
* `Playing`: The game is running and the players can do interactions
* `Break`: The game is paused by the host. Players can still do interactions but they wont be executed as long as the break lasts
* `Finished` : The game is over and there is a winner. This is the time to save the game for a replay
GameState.title: GameStatus

Error-Message.description: A message about that went wrong. Usefull to display users a short and usefull prompt

message.description: A short message describing what happened in human words

Error-Message.title: ErrorMessage

Action.description:
A queued action.
Actions are executed in their adding sequence which is represented by their index

index.description: The queue index of the action

executed.description: true if the action was allready executed

requestor.description: The index of the player this instruction came from

Action.title: Action

RoundPhase.description:
A round consits of 3 Phases each phase does different things
* `Upgrade` : Purchase Upgrades with energy cubes
* `Programming` : Programm your robot(s)
* `Activation` : The robots execute their code
RoundPhase.title: RoundPhase

UpgradeShop.description: A shop to buy upgrades from. Each element is buyable once and then vanishes from the list

Upgrade.description: A upgrade is a module making a robot stronger

cost.description: The energy cost to buy this upgrade

name.description: The ame to display for this Upgrade. ***Not*** unique (identifying)

permanent.description: if true the card belongs to the player for the rest of the game

description.description:
A description about the effect of the card.
Variables are using the format `{name}` where *name* refers to the names in `values`.

rounds.description: If the Upgrade is not permanent this variable defines the number of rounds this Upgrade works

values.description:
Defines number values for the upgrade.
Example: Effect: "You have {registers} additonal Registers"
`{registers}` is the number of the regsiters (that will be added) and the exact value will be defined in here (`values`)

Upgrade.title: Upgrade

RobotCommand.description: A command for a robot to execute

parameters.description:
Defines parameters for the instruction.
Example: Effect: "Move {steps} steps forward"
`{steps}` is the number of steps the robot will do. And the exact value (of steps) will be defined in here (`values`)

description.description:
A description about the effect of the command.
Variables are using the format `{name}` where *name* refers to the names in `values`.

name.description: The ame to display for this Command. ***Not*** unique (identifying)

times.description: Describes how often this command is going to be executed

RobotCommand.title: RobotCommand

Pair.description: A named value. A pair of an index and value. (Part of a map)

name.description: The name the value is bound to

value.description: The value behind the name. Can be null

Pair.title: Pair

UpgradeType.description:
Defines the type (the code/actions) this card will have
* `generator` : Generates *x* energy every round
UpgradeType.title: UpgradeType

Instruction.description: Defines what a command will do
Instruction.title: Instruction

Player.description:
A player attending in a game.
#### Warning
This is **not** permanent. It is created and removed with the game (or with you joining and leaving the game)

id.description:
This id uniquely identifys the player (in a game).

 **Not** to be confused with the `uid` which is used for authentication
id.title: PlayerID

controlled_entities.description: The list of entities controlled by this player

on-turn.description: f this is true rhe player is able to interact at the moment

active.description: Defines if the player is actively playing. If this is false the player does random moves. This is only false if the player disconnects

display_name.description: The display name of a player including rules
display_name.title: PlayerName

Player.title: Player

PlayerID.description:
This id uniquely identifys the player (in a game).

 **Not** to be confused with the `uid` which is used for authentication
PlayerID.title: PlayerID

EntityID.description:
The unique identification of this entity.
*!!!* This is not the id of the player
This value will be autogenerated by the api and is read only
EntityID.title: EntityID

Replay.description:
## BETA (Adressed in V0.1.2)
A replay consists of all data needed to replay a game. Means starting conditions and every change that was made
Replay.title: Replay

EntityActionType.description:
Defines the action itsselft (what the action is doing)

`pass` means that nothing is done and the action wont happen

If a type starts with `edit` then all actions within the domain of the second word (eg. remove, add, change) are adressed
EntityActionType.title: EntityActionType
